website_summaries.verdict: A premium CVT fluid that can be used in a wide range of vehicles.
pros: Offers enhanced friction durability for a smoother drive for longer transmission life
Provides superior high-temperature protection to resist oxidation
Delivers excellent variator torque capacity to prevent belt or chain slippage
Suitable for use in most passenger cars fitted with push belt transmissions
cons: May void the warranty of some vehicles

customer_reviews.title: Works on Nissan Cube CVT
customer_reviews.text: After I replaced it I was afraid I ruined my transmission. The slipping and roughness of my transmission continued. However after about 500 miles my transmission feels confident again. It's almost like the fluid had to break-in. Whatever the case I'm glad to see a much cheaper alternative to the Nissan NS-2. This was done on a 2008 Nissan Cube with 115k miles.
customer_reviews.author: T. Nooen

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended for our 07 Altima, while doing the flush go ahead and add a cooler. Your Wallet and car will thank you!
customer_reviews.text: Works great, ideally you'll want to flush out the old junk (non-chemical), and while you're at it add in a transmission cooler ($40-60). I am mentioning the cooler at the same time due to how cheap Nissan was with their CVTs from 2007-~2012 on their Altima line. Their newer Altimas have the cooler now... Don't get ripped off from Nissan using their fluid or cooler (I believe it's $250 and should have been included to begin with). Anyway, this fluid and the cooler fixed the Transmission whine noise as well as the codes and slipping. Highly recommended. Brought new life to our car that's at 150k.
customer_reviews.author: Felicity

customer_reviews.title: Excellent For 2011 Nissan Rogue Requiring Nissan NS-2
customer_reviews.text: I got a used Rogue with 68k miles and wanted to change the fluid without breaking the bank with the expensive Nissan NS-2 fluid also I was told by a Nissan mechanic to avoid the Nissan and Idemitsu fluids since they think it is one of the reasons for the CVT failures on Nissan's I drained the pan (4.5 qts) and replaced with Castrol Transmax CVT and right away noticed an improvement with acceleration and with some of the droning sound. I'm very impressed with this product. If your CVT is out of warranty, you can afford to regularly change your fluids with this price.
customer_reviews.author: Rowdy

customer_reviews.title: Works great for 2001 4runner
customer_reviews.text: Used this in my 3rd gen 4runner. Since they don't make dexron III anymore, I did extensive reading online seeing what is a good replacement. Some say dexron VI is backwards compatible, but being that my truck is almost 15 years old, I didn't want to risk it. I also read that dex/merc is the best replacement for dexron III, and works well. Figured I'd give it a try. Replaced a gallon's worth of transmission fluid and 1000 miles later, I have had no problems with my transmission, in fact it runs slightly smother. Just make sure not to overfill!
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: No Worries.
customer_reviews.text: Changed the CVT yesterday n it runs awesome!!!The whining when you accelerate stopped. Shifts great. Rpms are down as I do alot of Freeway driving. Highly recommend this product to the Nissan Family. Will be ordering for my Wife's Rogue. Dealership wanted 189.00 just to drain n fill mine!!If you change your oil then this is a breeze. Drain and fill.
customer_reviews.author: James Julson

customer_reviews.title: be careful of leaks when unboxing.
customer_reviews.text: ordered and arrived on time but all bottles came leaking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great price for this fluid
customer_reviews.text: Great price for this fluid. It's getting harder to find regular original MERCON spec fluid for older fords. This Castrol MERCON meets all the ford requirements. TIP: DO NOT use MERCON V in place of regular MERCON. It is not interchangeable like Ford claims it is. Your transmission will not work correctly as MERCON V is synthetic and regular MERCON is not.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Franklin

customer_reviews.title: this is a good substitute for the expensive OE transmission fluid
customer_reviews.text: If you're out of warranty on your 2011 Nissan Sentra, as I am, this is a good substitute for the expensive OE transmission fluid. 20,000 miles on the CVT transmission with this fluid and no issues. I do multiple drain and fills so this makes the complete replacement possible without spending a ton of money. Again, do not use this if you are interested in preserving your warranty but if you're out of warranty, don't hesitate to use this fluid.
customer_reviews.author: Eric R. Drouant

customer_reviews.title: Made Honda transmission good again.
customer_reviews.text: Looks awesome for Honda 2002 Accord. I can feel a huge difference in shifting after transmission fluid change. Will drain one more time to let go the old Honda transmission oil. It mentions compatibility with ATF Z1 on the back of the jug for Hondas & Acuras y'all.
customer_reviews.author: Hawk

customer_reviews.title: All in all nothing bad to say
customer_reviews.text: I replaced the CVT fluid in my 2008 Altima 3.5 with this one. Smooth shifting, and quiet transmission performance. The price cannot be beat as well. The fluid is red. All in all nothing bad to say. Definitely a great alternative to the OEM product.
customer_reviews.author: Anita Reichmann

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to NS-3
customer_reviews.text: Used on my 2013 Nissan Altima. Worked great! Immediately seemed to make the transmission behave more smoothly. I’ll update if things change. However I’m super happy. BTW the 2013 Nissan Altima needs about 3.5 quarts. Be sure to use the overflow drain after filling it. Good videos about this on YouTube. Basically. Drain, Fill, heat engine in park, use the other drain to remove excess. There is no real dipstick?!? Done!!!
customer_reviews.author: TechFam

customer_reviews.title: 2005 Honda Odyssey Touring
customer_reviews.text: I used this for the transmission fluid flush on my 2005 Honda Odyssey Touring with 221k miles. Unknown when last transmission fluid change was, but it's part of Honda's maintenance schedule - so ~30-60k miles. I ran this fluid for a few weeks (~500 miles) before flushing it out and putting in the Honda OEM ATF. In the Odyssey, you cannot drain all of the fluid out the first drain (some left in cooler, lines, solenoids). The recommended total "flush" is to fill/drain 3x times (I only did 2x). On the 2x fill I used the Honda OEM ATF, since the cost is reasonable for my budget. I cannot tell a difference in shifting/drive-quality between Honda OEM ATF and this.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Like others stated
customer_reviews.text: Worked wonders on my wife's ailing CVT for 2011 Nissan Rogue. Like others stated, the shuddering seems to have regressed since using this fluid. I'm hoping with regular fluid changes with this product, we can make this transmission last a while longer. I wish this product had been in production longer. (Or that I had known about it sooner.) I feel like regular CVT transmission flushes (every 10,000) would have prevent some of the issues we are having now.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Butner

customer_reviews.title: Worked great, probably 40
customer_reviews.text: Used this product in the past on my 2008 Sentra for a drain and flush. Worked great, probably 40,000 miles on it and no problems. Really quietened down my CVT "whine". Time for another service, so I ordered another case. The 6 quarts is just perfect for a drain and fill on the car. Out of warranty, so no worries, but the product really does work good!
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I use this on my 2012 nissan altima 2.5 automatic and I tell you I have 300k miles with original transmission and it's still going. So what I'm trying to say is this product definitely works and needs more acknowledgement.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Montalvo

customer_reviews.title: BEST CVT FLUID
customer_reviews.text: Changed 2017 Corolla CVT at 40M with 2 qts. OEM Aisin fluid for first round. Used this Castrol for the second 2 qt. change. Noticeably less slip. Low speed shudder (belt slip?) eliminated. Shifting smoothed to the point of becoming unnoticeable. In all fairness, Lubegard CVT was also added on the second change. My only complaint is the price. While least expensive in comparison to other fluids, all these synthetic fluids are primarily designed for unprecedented profit. Toyota simply relabels Aisin fluid and doubles the price. OEM licensing is another profitable scam. -1 star for high cost. +4 stars for quality and comparative value.
customer_reviews.author: Live Sound Co.

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PERFORMING FLUID FOR MY CHAMBER MYLAR VACUUM FOOD SEALER.
customer_reviews.text: THE COST/ FLUID OZ IS THE BEST THROUGH MY SEVERAL COMPARISONS OFFERED AT AMAZON. MY CHAMBER VACUUM SEALERS PUMP RUN SMOOTH AND QUIET PRODUCING PRECISE LINEAR VACUUM PRESSURE THROUGH THE ENTIRE VACUUM TIME CYCLE. NO MORE THAN 26 SECONDS TO REACH MAX VACUUM PRESSURE ON ME VEVOR DZ-260C CHAMBER VACUUM SEALER. OTHER PEOPLE'S SETTINGS I HAVE VIEWED ARE HIGHER THAN 26 SECONDS WHICH TELLS ME THEY ARE NOT OPTIMIZING THE VACUUM SEALER WITH A GREAT LUBRICANT. NOTE: FOR MAX PUMP PERFORMANCE, ADD SOME MICRO LUBRICANT (I.E Z-MAX OR AIR TOOL LUBRICANT) TO ALLOW FOR METAL ABSORPTION REDUCING INTERNAL FRICTION RESULTS IN INCREASED POWER OUTPUT AND VACUUM PRESSURE DECREASING PUMP TIME-TO-MAX PRESSURE PROLONGING THE VACUUM PUMP PARTS!!!
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL

customer_reviews.title: worked perfect with my 2012 altima
customer_reviews.text: The transmission on my Altima 2012 was whining and slipping. I don't think that the trans fluid was ever changed. I drained approx. 6 quarts of black trans fluid, dropped the pan, cleaned the magnets and changed the filter. The car is running like new again. I have 120k miles on it now. Much cheaper than using Nissan trans fluid.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry D.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended for imports
customer_reviews.text: Oddly enough, Amazon is shipping this via Prime to Hawaii. Transmission fluid is very expensive, and luckily Amazon can deliver! I use this in my 2005 Nissan Frontier, 2006 Nissan Xterra, as well as our 2000 Honda Odyssey with no problems. So I keep a bunch of bottles on-hand as I do a lot of repairs on the side for friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: Stanward S. M. Oshiro

customer_reviews.title: Noticed a huge improvement in performance
customer_reviews.text: Did a drain and fill with a new filter on a 2005 toyota matrix automatic. Transmission shifts quicker and more on time. Has 220k miles I'm pretty sure it never got changed either. I noticed when full throttle and downshifting the transmission does slip very little. oh well. not terrible great oil, happy I changed it out
customer_reviews.author: WhatWouldJoeyDo

customer_reviews.title: 1 ton diesel with 4 speed automatic
customer_reviews.text: I bought a used 2004 Dodge Ram 3500 with 67k miles and a never serviced transmission. The shifts were clunky and drivability was poor. I replaced the oil pan with a cast aluminum unit that has a drain plug and a couple of extra quarts capacity. At 6k intervals when I change the oil I drain out 7 quarts of ATF and replace it with the Castrol. The transmission has been revitalized with smooth comfortable shifts. I tow a 10,000# fifth wheel up 6% grades and the transmission fluid temperature has never gone over 205 degrees. Average running unladen temperature is 170 degrees. Very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Durb

customer_reviews.title: Perfect product, perfect price for my F150
customer_reviews.text: Been doing preventive maintenance on my '03 F150 recently, and decided to try dropping the transmission drain pan and replace the filter. Castrol Mercon V ATF meets all the Ford requirements, and this 6-pack is a very nice price. It was delivered on-time and as promised. I'd already purchased the filter, and had the job done in less than 2 hours (I work slowly and methodically). I needed 5 quarts to replenish the tranny, and having the 6th as a spare for my garage is just what I need to top it off if necessary over the next few months.
customer_reviews.author: CD

customer_reviews.title: 2013 Jeep Compass
customer_reviews.text: I'm old school, so I change transmission fluid every 75,000 miles regardless of recommendations. I put this in my wife's 2013 Jeep Compass at the 150,000 mile transmission fluid change and it got rid of the vibration while sitting at stop lights. Her car runs better than ever, it now has 170,000+ miles.
customer_reviews.author: John D Bee

customer_reviews.title: Subaru Outback 2011 2.5i at 155k miles
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure if this was going to work, but I replaced about 5.5 quarts on my outback. So far, thousands of miles later, everything is still working. I'm not noticing a big change in performance, but it was only the first drain & fill so maybe the next one will show more improvement. The important part is it's not broken.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Trans fluid that works
customer_reviews.text: Good trans fluid that works in my Hondas with conventional automatic transmissions. Please note, however, that although it meets the Japanese standards for ATF on these vehicles, I was informed by Castrol that these fluids are NOT approved by Honda for use in their vehicles. Still, it meets the standards used by the mfg so it should be OK (as long as your vehicle is already out of warranty). Considering it's priced significantly lower than the genuine Honda ATF-Z1 or it's replacement ATF-DW1 it's worth looking into.
customer_reviews.author: Gary F.

customer_reviews.title: The best CVT fluid
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this CVT fluid for over a year now..this is the best fluid on the market for CVT. I own a Suzuki 2011 kizashi and I use to get a whistling noise from the transmission so I decided to try that fluid.....it stopped the noise after driving the car. One thing to note is that the container say CVT black but the guild is actually red....I also use that fluid in my Mitsubishi RVR (outlander sport ) and have had no problems. This fluid is cheaper and better than the Mitsubishi fluid in my openion.
customer_reviews.author: Lory Pierre

customer_reviews.title: ATF Fluid
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my 2011 Toyota Tundra. Transmission feels like new again. Replaced fluid at 80000 miles due to solenoid error (which I replaced too). Old fluid was pretty dark and metal dust on magnets. Toyota recommends to change at 100000, but I'm glad l changed earlier for peace of mind. Also used the Slippery Pete pump to pump back into transmission case.
customer_reviews.author: Frito

customer_reviews.title: CVT Transmission fluid
customer_reviews.text: 30yr ASE certified mechanic. I've used their products since 1981. Castrol is one of the best on the market for CVT fluids and engine oil as well.
customer_reviews.author: KGB

customer_reviews.title: GREAT value for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Thanks to regular maintenance including Castrol CVT transmission fluid my 12 year old Honda Civic Hybrid continues to deliver mileage in the low 40’s mpg! I’m still pinching myself at the price per quart. :)
customer_reviews.author: Jay Riley

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Had in my Nissan cvt for 10000 miles with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Sesali Nihoff

customer_reviews.title: great for my 2008 Civic
customer_reviews.text: This transmission fluid keeps my 2008 Honda Civic EX-L sedan with 105k miles shifting smoothly. For some odd reason, only 3 quarts drains on this model Civic (of the 5 quart capacity, I think), but doing that every other oil change or so (roughly 10k miles) seems to work well. When I initially switched over to Castrol High Mileage, I replaced 3 quarts, drove a few days, replaced another 3 quarts, drove a few days, then replaced another 3 quarts (as recommended for a "full" transmission fluid change). Smooth, quick shifting when accelerating and the transmission downshifts as expected. I hope to put at least another 50k miles on this car (roughly 5 years), maybe more.
customer_reviews.author: D....

customer_reviews.title: Better than the Nissan Factory CVT Fluid!
customer_reviews.text: Do your research people and you will find out that the often reported Nissan Jatco transmission problems are more related to the terrible original cvt fluid used during new car build factory installation! This CVT fluid by Castrol out performs Nissan Factory CVT fluid in viscosity performance and protection of the main CVT transmission belt! In fact, many Nissan Dealership service departments use this exact cvt transmission fluid for servicing Jatco cvt transmission fluid flushes and refills! Very satisfied! Noticeable improvement with smoother transmission and slight fuel economy improvement as well! Don't be a sucker and be "fear baited" into buying the Nissan Factory CVT fluid at 3X-4X the price!
customer_reviews.author: Maria Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Suitable replacement for factory transmission fluid
customer_reviews.text: My '04 Camry has 175K miles on vehicle. Transmission fluid was dark but not smelling burnt. Replaced transmission filter and performed transmission flush by loosing trans coolant line at the radiator and adding fluid to the trans through the dipstick. Replaced approximately 8 quarts including oil removed at filter change. Fluid now bright red and at proper level on dipstick. Shifts are smoother and more consistent now.
customer_reviews.author: Retired ASE Tech

customer_reviews.title: Best CVT fluid
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could give this 10 stars. My 2008 Nissan Sentra was making the dreaded whining noise. The warrenty had just expired. Was told a replacement transmission would be $3400. I read the reviews here and decided to give it a try. Replaced the fluid and instantly the noise was gone. Car drives like it is new again. Best CVT fluid and cheapest too!
customer_reviews.author: STM

customer_reviews.title: 2007 Mazda 5
customer_reviews.text: I used on a 2007 Mazda 5 and did a drain and refill over several motor oil changes to get fresh transmission fluid into the transmission because that model Mazda trans wasn't easily serviced. It seems to shift a bit smoother, but it is hard to be sure since it was a slow process to get the fluid changed. I can say it has been thousands of miles since the last drain and refill and the transmission is shifting smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: SWB

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good...
customer_reviews.text: Finally got around to replacing the fluid in the Nissan Rogues CVT and fingers crossed, knocking on wood, seems to have cured the slipping and non-shifting that had been occurring in hot weather or extended operation. Old fluid looked like engine oil from a diesel so definitely past its prime and hopefully I'll have no issues with compatibility that I have read other having with the non-Nissan fluid.
customer_reviews.author: almusiqi

customer_reviews.title: Works well in Honda Accords/Civics
customer_reviews.text: I own three Honda's and this is my go-to transmission fluid now. Honda makes excellent CVT transmissions but I'm now a believer in changing fluid every 30K-40K miles due to issues I've had with Nissan's poorly designed transmissions and fluids. Shifting feels more consistent and so far no "limp" like the Nissan's when the tranny gets hot. Must have in the Texas heat!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Mazda3
customer_reviews.text: Used on 2005 Mazda 3. If you are looking for ATF for a Mazda 3, this is the one to get. The commonly recommended ATF, Mobile 1 synthetic ATF is no longer mazda M-V compatible. This Castrol ATF is not only m-v compatible but also a great bang for the buck. Three gallons is enough fluids to drain and flush the transmission three times and still have enough fluid left over to change out the power steering fluid. After each and every drain and flush the car noticeably had less "shift shock" the common 1st to 2nd gear annoyance with Mazda3s, until it was finally a nonissue.
customer_reviews.author: robert

customer_reviews.title: Maxx didn’t like it!
customer_reviews.text: I know a lot of people have had good luck with this fluid but my 2010 maxima does not like it! It didn’t ruin my trans or anything but the trans was very jerky and ran very very hot, even with an additional cooler installed. I’m not saying it’s a bad product, it just didn’t work for me. I drained it out and filled with Idemitsu, and everything is back to normal. I’ll be sticking with the Idemitsu from now on! Good luck. Btw I have also tried the Valvoline and although it stinks to high heaven, it also worked better for me then the Castrol. Just one mans experience, doesn’t mean it will be the same for everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Sawyer7424

customer_reviews.title: Great product at great price. Careful of leakage upon delivery...
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. Does what it claims to do and makes my 14 Accord CVT very smooth. One hit for slight leakage on one of the 6 bottles. Wasn't enough to wet the packaging but was leaking.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: You need to investigate what the correct product is for your car.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to do a drain and fill on my transmission and did some reading about it. There are some Volvo sites that give some bad information. One very authoritatively states that you need Toyota trans fluid. This isn’t correct. My owners manual says a ‘98 Volvo uses dex/mercon which is what this is. The price was good. The high milage was really inexpensive. Check you manual before you buy.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Hobbs

customer_reviews.title: would not recommend for replacement for matic j/s
customer_reviews.text: would not recommend for replacement for matic j/s. I replaced my 2006 infiniti g35x transmission oil with this 3.5qt at a time with 3months interval in between and my transmission started shifting much harsher. Took it to nissan for transmission flush and it has been much softer/smoother shifting since. I would say stick with matic j/s or whatever manufacturer recommends for your vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Slim

customer_reviews.title: Good replacement for a MUCH better price.
customer_reviews.text: Replaced the transmission fluid in my 2016 Mitsubishi Outlander with this. It works fine. Shifting is still nice and smooth and quiet. The Mitsubishi J4 fluid would've cost me over $120 for 5. This cost under $40 for 6.
customer_reviews.author: Mystchyphe

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper than Honda tranny fluid. Works great!!
customer_reviews.text: I used this on my 2015 Honda Accord lx. It worked great and is more inexpensive than the Honda fluid. Only for CVT transmissions.
customer_reviews.author: archijon

customer_reviews.title: Performance enhanced
customer_reviews.text: Improved performance after approximately 1500 miles. Initially 1000 miles, problem free. 300 miles after, a few sloping here and there, especially when carrying a heavy load on an incline. Now all that is gone, RPM is about 2k when cruising at 70. Huge improvement
customer_reviews.author: Haruna Salifu

customer_reviews.title: Compatible with BMW
customer_reviews.text: I ordered their three jug (1 gallon ea) box to fill a newly rebuilt BMW E39 transmission, this fluid worked great for the ZF HP5-19 transmission. No need to buy the expensive dealership type.
customer_reviews.author: photomark

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for 2007 Nissan Murano smoother shifting this brand is made by BP i love there products and $35 for 6 quarts is amazing compared to buying the official Nissan NS2 use this with confidence
customer_reviews.author: Javier

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff for the Japanese cars in my life
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was needing for my 98 Toyota 4Runner. I had run out and needed more at a good price. Ordered this pack of 6 to meet me DEX III needs. I used this in my 06 Suzuki Grand Vitara and my Toyota. Good all around oil. Even works in my power steering.
customer_reviews.author: Liberated Seaman

customer_reviews.title: Fluid looked new after 35k in 2005 mustang gt
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this in my 2005 mustang gt with a manual for the last 35 thousand miles and love it. After 35 thousand miles the fluid came out like new. I didn’t even need to change my fluid yet. Trust me if you have a 2005 2009 mustang gt with a manual. Don’t use synthetic trans fluid. It’s designed for mercon 1! You will ruin the trans
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Best automatic transmission product for Japanese and other foreign vehicle classes
customer_reviews.text: Having worked with numerous different auto transmission products in 26 years of practice, this Castrol product is one of the best on the market. After many tests and reviews, this product proved to extend the longevity of correct operations of the automatic transmissions.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Feldman

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Like all mercron 5 transmission fluids it's expensive. It seemed to help. It has a stronger detergent smell than the Valvoline I used before. I was experiencing torque converter shudder. I did the Jmod and changed all of my fluid and added the mercron 5 lubegard pack. It has seemed to have fixed it. It went from not highway driveability to only shuddering under high load/ uphill situations. I may still have to replace my torque converter. But at least I don't have to do it in the winter- outside in the cold.
customer_reviews.author: Mike B.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent CVT fluid
customer_reviews.text: Unless you're in warranty (which then use factory CVT fluid) get these and $$$ave money!
customer_reviews.author: The smiley face on Amazon means A to Z -- CRAZY!

customer_reviews.title: Did wonders for my 2007 Dodge Caliber transmission!
customer_reviews.text: After much research- I found that this CVT fluid is ideal for the Dodge Caliber transmission. We were having minor issues with the shifting of the transmission. I did a filter and fluid change and it is now shifting and performing as it should.
customer_reviews.author: INTELLECTUAL GENIUS

customer_reviews.title: Different trannys use different fluids. Make sure it's compatible with your trannys before using it.
customer_reviews.text: I filled my 4T45E transmission with this fluid, but I need to have my 2006 Malibu inspected before I can drive it. Therefore, I haven't tested this fluid thoroughly, but the transmission works and I have no doubt that it's a good choice for my transmission.
customer_reviews.author: T. Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Love Castrol. This trans fluid is great stuff
customer_reviews.text: Love Castrol. This trans fluid is great stuff. Even changing out a few quarts makes it smoother with my Nissan titan. I am going to change out a few quarts at every oil change from now on as it has 170 thousand miles now and did have one complete service at 89 thousand.
customer_reviews.author: jeff billington

customer_reviews.title: Replacement for NS-2
customer_reviews.text: Used in my 2012 Juke. That NS-2 costs nearly twice what I paid for last year and got all I needed for less than a third for what the NS-2 costs now. No problems after one month and 1700mi.
customer_reviews.author: Mad Squabbles

customer_reviews.title: Smooth shifts and good performance
customer_reviews.text: Great fluid. Works in my 98 Volvo s70. Need to buy some more to do drain and fill changes but it’s already driving better.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Alternate to OEM Nissan Auto Trans Fluid
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as an alternative to Nissan Auto Trans Fluid. Very pleased with results. No issues and much better value. I like Castrol products and would assume this is a high quality fluid like all their other products.
customer_reviews.author: KO

customer_reviews.title: Hard to get at least for me
customer_reviews.text: Hard to find this stuff in stores and if you drive older vehicles like me it’s kinda nice to be able to get some when the time comes and I was able to get it and get the job done
customer_reviews.author: seth

customer_reviews.title: Vehicle is running great.
customer_reviews.text: Works just as well as OEM transmission fluid. I install in my 2010 Maxima at 133000 miles. Vehicle is running great.
customer_reviews.author: Orande Daring

customer_reviews.title: Excellent fluid for NS-2 CVT
customer_reviews.text: 6.5 quarts added to a 2008 Altima Coupe CVT after changing out pan completely changed the operation of the transmission. The clunky/jerkiness went away and the unit operates as smooth as silk. Nothing else will go into this transmission!
customer_reviews.author: m C

customer_reviews.title: Works great as a replacement for Nissan NS-3.
customer_reviews.text: Way cheaper than Nissan NS-3 and works well. I'm out of warranty so no need to stick to the factory crap. I use this every 30k miles on a Nissan quest. Still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: Twitch

customer_reviews.title: Good price!!
customer_reviews.text: Since putting this in my 2016 Honda Accord, I feel a noticable difference...my car is shifting smoother and feels much improved. I'm very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Honda420NH

customer_reviews.title: Smoother trans
customer_reviews.text: Used it for my BMW E90 with the GM trans. Transmission feels alot smoother....only thing I didnt like is that my transmission mechanism are louder now. Its noticable to hear but not something to worry.
customer_reviews.author: schmid

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: My 2010 Nissan Sentra with a CVT transmission calls for Castrol Transmax, looked all around & this was definitely the best price for the product, it arrived in 2 days (with prime) & was exactly as described.
customer_reviews.author: angel greathouse

customer_reviews.title: Chrysler/Jeep fluid
customer_reviews.text: Must have if you have a Chrysler/Newer jeep vehicle. I replaced the trans filter in a 2001 Jeep Wrangler 4x4 with auto trans and this is the exact fluid specified by Chrysler to use. ATF+4 is hard to find locally, just as easy to pick up a box. My only issue is there was trans fluid leaking from one of the bottles in the box
customer_reviews.author: 2k3Mach1

customer_reviews.title: Smooth shifting
customer_reviews.text: Did a drain and fill on a 2004 Titan transmission. Immediately noticed a smooth shift. Will do a transmission drain and fill along with the regular engine oil changes for the foreseeable future. Don't waste your money on the expensive Nissan transmission oil.
customer_reviews.author: Darren

customer_reviews.title: hearing
customer_reviews.text: I've either lost my hearing ... or this CVT fluid just fixed my tranny whine & shudder ... its what I expected from Castrol
customer_reviews.author: waltezoid

customer_reviews.title: Good for Ford trucks
customer_reviews.text: I used this Castro Trannsmax Mercon 5 for first change at 48k miles, and again at 90k miles with same fluid. Now pass 100k mile mark, my 2008 F150 4.6L still takes me to work and back home 50 miles round trip every days and pulling my Boston Whaler to the lakes all most every other weeks. still run smooth, shift smooth. I would highly recommend this fluid if you own a Ford.
customer_reviews.author: Binh Duc Ho

customer_reviews.title: Good tranmission Oil
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this to change my transmission oil on my 50,000 mile 2003 hyundai elantra the car shifts really smooth, i read that you need to get oem oil directly from the dealer i have no warranty so i decided to go with this and so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Javier

customer_reviews.title: Great CVT fluid.
customer_reviews.text: Meets a lot of manufacturers specs for CVT transmission fluid. There is a list on Castrol's website for all the details. My Suzuki shifted perfect with this fluid and I would expect the same performance in any transmission Castrol recommends it for. Plus it is cheaper than any fluid you would find locally. Win win.
customer_reviews.author: Tanner Vermeer

customer_reviews.title: Great OEM substitute!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for my Honda Accord! And it was cheaper than autozone and oreillys by a dollar!
customer_reviews.author: Grant Talladino

customer_reviews.title: Works for 2014 Mitsubishi Outlander sport cvt
customer_reviews.text: Works for 2014 Mitsubishi Outlander sport CVT. It doesn't say it on the bottle but the Castrol website says it is CVT J4 compatible. Great price but I did find it on sale at Autozone for a bit cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: works well in 2001 Tundra
customer_reviews.text: I've tried Mobil 1 Dexron compatible ATF and did not at all like the way my Tundra transmission shifted. This performs like the original Dexron II that came with the vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Desert Rat

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Works great in Jatco & Nissan CVT transmissions. Wish they didn’t ship it with the box on its side, inside the amazon box. One bottle was leaking the whole time it was being shipped
customer_reviews.author: Jordan A.

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: I can't vouch for longetivity, but it seems to work good so far. One of the cheapest options on the market but does a good job.
customer_reviews.author: The JolleyRancher

customer_reviews.title: Less cost better quality
customer_reviews.text: Castrol work better than oem oil on most cvt transmission ... %75 less expensive than the brand manufacturer and 4x better quality
customer_reviews.author: Sahar Albannai

customer_reviews.title: Good quality trans fluid!
customer_reviews.text: I used this trans fluid in my Chevy K20 for my turbo 400 when I did a filter and fluid change, works great and have had no trouble.
customer_reviews.author: sixftmoose

customer_reviews.title: He was very pleased with how convenient it was to order and how ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband ordered this transmission fluid for his classic mustang. He was very pleased with how convenient it was to order and how quickly it was shipped and delivered. I would recommend this transmission fluid for any classic car, as it is a high quality brand sold at an affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: Southern Charm

customer_reviews.title: Great synthetic transmission fluid
customer_reviews.text: I have used this fluid for years in all of my vehicles, Ford Focus, Chevy Colorado, Nissan Frontier. It is great fluid.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J Ehr

customer_reviews.title: Worth it, I'm at 100k+ miles and it runs smooth
customer_reviews.text: This thing works will in my 2014 Honda Civic. I changed my own oil and will be buying more of this to keep around!
customer_reviews.author: AALin

customer_reviews.title: Money for the buck.
customer_reviews.text: It works well for my Nissan Altima much better price in regards to the OEM transmission oil that Nissan sells which is just so expensive. Since my car is not on warranty anymore Castro transmission oil is synthetic.
customer_reviews.author: RG

customer_reviews.title: Decent fluid, not green
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for application, however it was not green like the OE fluid in vehicle. It is compatible with fluid in vehicle, just different color. Makes for a funny looking color ATF when checking levels
customer_reviews.author: MacGyver Jr.Top Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Good for Mitsubishi ATF
customer_reviews.text: This was one of the few options available for an aftermarket replacement for Mitsubishi's funky named and labeled ATF. This came out to be a lot cheaper than buying Mitsubishi ATF from the dealership.
customer_reviews.author: MacGyver Jr.Top Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Bought two gallons to flush the 4l60e transmission on my 04 Avalanche. Works great so far and seems to shift smoother.
customer_reviews.author: lk

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for 2014 Versa Note CVT
customer_reviews.text: Replaced the CVT fluid in my 2014 versa note. The transmission had gone 112k miles on the original fluid and it was shuddering horribly all the time. IMMEDIATE improvement. Runs like new again, no more shudders at all.
customer_reviews.author: B Krueger

customer_reviews.title: Good value and performance
customer_reviews.text: I have run this on a lot of old Toyota’s and I’ve never had any issues. A very decent synthetic blend for daily drivers.
customer_reviews.author: marlin95

customer_reviews.title: Works great on my 2011 jeep compass
customer_reviews.text: It seems to work well. With my 2011 Jeep Compass...... You will need 2 more Quart's. To get the 7 an half Quarts that is needed to full it right. Still A lot cheaper. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: william j mccabe

customer_reviews.title: Works so far
customer_reviews.text: I flushed my Suzuki CVT with this 6 months (7,000 miles) ago. At first I was concerned because the factory stuff was green and this is red (or vice versa I don’t recall). But it meets the factory specs and the color is most likely just a dye.
customer_reviews.author: aronf_53

customer_reviews.title: Good alternative
customer_reviews.text: I used this as a replacement for the factory Nissan CVT fluid due to major slipping. The car drives like new again.
customer_reviews.author: pen name

customer_reviews.title: Just as good the Dealer fluid
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my CVT 2012 Jeep Patriot, had the whine and decided to change out the fluid. Ran it 100 degree weather for about 2 and half hours, ran like a champ. These stuff is amazing and cheaper than the dealer stuff
customer_reviews.author: Frank Garcia Jr

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: Only 5 quarts came had to drive on low fluid to get another one
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great 👍 fluid for high mileage vehicles
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tranny fluid,for a Saturn Vue V-6 honda running gear,with 205,000 Mi,allready running smoothly,cleared up hard shifting in less than 200 mi
customer_reviews.author: Dana J

customer_reviews.title: Wining gone.. wow
customer_reviews.text: 2012 Nissan Altima..needed 5 1/2 quarts and worked great .. amazing.. the CVT wining no longer there... also installed a diy Haden transmission oil cooler.
customer_reviews.author: jill evans

customer_reviews.title: Stands the Test of Time
customer_reviews.text: Trusted and proven over decades of use in every car I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: MelloPi

customer_reviews.title: Taco friendly!
customer_reviews.text: Worked well as a new install once I was done flushing the power-steering on my 2001 Tacoma (139K miles). No issues and runs great, to date.
customer_reviews.author: Leterbuck

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Pleased
customer_reviews.text: 2015 Nissan Rouge. Shifts smoother than before. All noises, shakes, and shutters have disappeared. Kind of amazing. Fully drained measured 3.5 qts.
customer_reviews.author: echo

customer_reviews.title: It a Solid product.
customer_reviews.text: Its in my Prius now drove it 5000 mile no problem well update once i change the fluid again
customer_reviews.author: Dis Rojanasopondist

customer_reviews.title: Good trans fluid
customer_reviews.text: Great transmission oil good for the price it was cheaper to buy the 5qt then buy individual qts.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Yuran

customer_reviews.title: Great cheap!
customer_reviews.text: I use basic ATF in my 2stroke dirk bike transmissions. This is 200% cheaper than belray or redline.
customer_reviews.author: R.R

product_meta.title: Castrol - 15B652-6PK Transmax ATF Black CVT Transmission Fluid - 1 Quart, (Pack of 6)
product_meta.description: Style:Automatic| Size:1 Quart - 6 PackCastrol Transmax CVT, formulated with Smooth Drive Technology and premium full-synthetic base oil, is designed for most continuously variable transmissions. Its superior technology enables longer transmission life. It is suitable for use in most passenger cars fitted with push belt transmissions. Ensuring peace of mind across a wide range of vehicles.
feature_bullets: Enhanced friction durability for a smoother drive for longer transmission life
Enhanced wear protection for longer transmission life
Superior high temperature protection to effectively resist oxidation
Superior variator torque capacity that can prevent belt or chain slippage

Suitable for use where: Toyota CVT Fluid TC, Toyota CVT Fluid FE, Nissan CVT Fluid NS-1, Nissan CVT Fluid NS-2, Nissan CVT Fluid NS-3, MMC DIAQUEEN ATF SP-III, MMC DIAQUEEN CVT Fluid J1, MMC DIAQUEEN CVT Fluid J4, Mazda CVTF 3320, Subaru i-CVT Fluid, Subaru i-CVT FG, Subaru Lineartronic High Torque Chain CVTF, Daihatsu AMMIX CVT Fluid DC, Daihatsu AMMIX CVT Fluid DFE, Suzuki CVT Fluid 3320, Suzuki CVT Fluid Green 1, Suzuki CVT Fluid Green 2, Suzuki CVTF TC, Suzuki NS-2, Honda HCF-2, Hyundai/Kia SP-III, Chrysler NS-2, Chrysler CVTF+4, Mini Cooper EZL799, Ford CVT23, MB 236.20
Superior technology enables longer transmission life
Enhanced friction durability for a "smoother for longer" driving experience
Superior high temperature performance to resist oxidation
Suitable for Nissan NS-1 and NS-2, Toyota TC, Mitsubishi DiaQueen J1, Subaru i-CVT fluid FG, Daihatsu CVT, Mazda and Suzuki 3320
